txt.en: Down the shoreline toward the flickering camp-fires and torches we moved. In the night, the shadows danced around the tents. Captives held outside the tents and nary a defender could be seen. It was an ambush....
As the battle fell quiet, a scream came from where we placed our launch; followed by the sound of fire on the sea and the screams of men and women going into the deep....
Return to the captain where you landed
'What have I done?\n\n'I have failed them all. I have lost my ship. I have lost it all....'
The crew of Nenglor encounters Yarikh ashore again, and this time prepares an assault to end the Corsair's time on the sea for good.

'No alarm. No warning. No soul watching over their only means of escape to their ship. We shall not make the same mistake as we did before.

'Leave their boats. The prize is the captain of these curs and him alone.

'Move swift into their camp, free the prisoners that they have captured and put an end to them.

'Go, swiftly.'
We made our way to shore in the cover of darkness. The Corsairs were unaware of our approach....
